name: chandra
description: OCR model that handles complex tables, forms, handwriting with full layout.
readme_summary: Chandra is an OCR model that converts images and PDFs into structured data formats like HTML, Markdown, or JSON, preserving layout information. It supports handwriting, forms, tables, math, and complex layouts, and offers both local (HuggingFace) and remote (vLLM server) inference modes.
key_features: Convert documents to markdown, html, or json with detailed layout information
Good support for tables, math, and complex layouts
Extracts images and diagrams, with captions and structured data
Two inference modes: local (HuggingFace) and remote (vLLM server)
primary_use_case: Converting images and PDFs into structured, machine-readable formats while preserving layout.
cover_image_prompt: An archaeologist carefully piecing together fragments of ancient scrolls into a perfectly structured digital document on a holographic display. The archaeologist uses advanced tools that reveal hidden text and reconstruct damaged layouts. The scrolls represent various document types like handwritten notes, complex tables, and mathematical equations. Digital particles flow from the reconstructed document, forming a clean JSON structure. Small UI elements display OCR confidence scores and layout bounding boxes. The scene is set in a futuristic lab with soft, diffused lighting. The image should be in a detailed 3D isometric illustration style with a color scheme of blues, greens, and golds.

name: code-sandbox-mcp
readme_summary: The Code Sandbox MCP Server is a lightweight server that allows AI assistants and LLM applications to safely execute code snippets using containerized environments. It leverages the llm-sandbox package to execute code, supporting languages like Python and JavaScript, and returns the output and error streams to the client.
key_features: Secure code execution in isolated containers
Support for Python and JavaScript code
Integration with Model Context Protocol (MCP) clients
Ability to pass environment variables to the sandbox
primary_use_case: Enabling AI assistants and LLM applications to safely execute code snippets.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a secure vault where lines of code, represented as glowing energy streams, are carefully processed and executed by robotic arms within transparent containers. The vault is connected to a network of AI assistants, visualized as ethereal figures, who send and receive the code streams. A central monitor displays real-time security metrics and execution logs. The scene is set in a futuristic, sterile environment with bright, focused lighting. Small UI elements show code snippets and data visualizations. The repository name, 'Code Sandbox MCP,' is subtly integrated into the vault's architecture. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.

name: leocad
description: A CAD application for creating virtual LEGO models
readme_summary: LeoCAD is a CAD (Computer-Aided Design) application specifically designed for creating virtual LEGO models. It offers a free and open-source solution for users to design and build LEGO creations on Windows, Linux, and macOS operating systems.
key_features: Multiple installation methods on Linux (Snap, AppImage, Flatpak, Source)
primary_use_case: Designing and building virtual LEGO models.
cover_image_prompt: A master architect meticulously constructing a towering LEGO castle in a digital workshop. The architect uses a holographic interface to manipulate virtual LEGO bricks, which materialize from glowing particles. The castle design is displayed on a large screen behind the architect, showcasing intricate details. Small UI elements around the scene display CAD controls and LEGO part selections. The repository name, 'LeoCAD,' is subtly integrated into the castle's foundation. The scene is set in a brightly lit, futuristic studio. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: every-pdf
description: ✍️ A powerful, all-in-one desktop PDF toolkit to edit, convert, merge, and secure your documents. Built with Electron, Next.js, and Python.
readme_summary: The repository hosts Every PDF, a cross-platform desktop application built with Electron, Next.js, and Python. It provides a comprehensive toolkit for PDF editing, conversion, merging, and security, offering features ranging from basic document tasks to professional-level editing.
primary_use_case: Desktop PDF editing, conversion, merging, and securing.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled artisan in a bright workshop, carefully assembling individual puzzle pieces representing different document formats (Word, Excel, images) into a seamless, complete PDF document. The artisan uses specialized tools that subtly resemble UI elements, like a merging icon or encryption lock. Digital particles float around the workspace, visualizing the data flow. A blueprint subtly displaying the 'Every PDF' logo hangs on the wall. The scene is brightly lit with a focus on clarity and precision. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and rich details.

name: lvgl
description: Embedded graphics library to create beautiful UIs for any MCU, MPU and display type.
readme_summary: LVGL is a free and open-source graphics library written in C, designed for creating embedded graphical user interfaces (GUIs) on microcontrollers (MCUs) and microprocessors (MPUs). It offers a wide range of widgets, styling options, and layout features, making it suitable for various display types and platforms with minimal resource requirements.
primary_use_case: Creating graphical user interfaces (GUIs) for embedded systems, including MCUs and MPUs.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan meticulously crafting a vibrant tapestry on a high-tech loom. The loom's threads are streams of code, weaving together buttons, charts, and other UI elements into a cohesive design. A small screen on the loom displays the LVGL logo and real-time rendering of the UI. The artisan carefully adjusts the colors and layout, bringing the digital design to life. The scene is set in a bright, modern workshop with a focus on precision and artistry. Digital particles subtly enhance the visual representation of the code. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: SimpMusic
description: A simple music app using YouTube Music for backend
readme_summary: SimpMusic is a free and open-source Android music player that utilizes YouTube Music as its backend. It offers features like ad-free background playback, browsing YouTube Music content, offline playback, synced lyrics, and support for SponsorBlock and Return YouTube Dislike, aiming to provide a comprehensive music listening experience.
key_features: Play music from YouTube Music or YouTube without ads
Browse Home, Charts, Podcast, Moods & Genre with YouTube Music data
Analyze playing data, create playlists, and sync with YouTube Music
SponsorBlock and Return YouTube Dislike support
primary_use_case: Playing music from YouTube Music on Android devices with added features like ad-blocking, offline playback, and synced lyrics.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled conductor leading an orchestra where each instrument represents a different music source (YouTube Music, Spotify, local files). The conductor's baton transforms raw audio streams into a harmonious symphony, visualized as glowing musical notes flowing from the instruments. A UI element resembling a music player is subtly integrated into the conductor's stand. The scene is set in a grand concert hall with warm, inviting lighting. Small digital particles representing data flow around the musicians. The composition is balanced and focused, with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: duelr
readme_summary: Duelr is an open-source tool for comparing the performance and quality of different Large Language Models (LLMs). It allows users to test multiple LLMs simultaneously, tracking metrics like latency, token usage, cost, and quality scores for length simplicity, readability, and JSON validity, facilitating informed decisions about LLM selection.
primary_use_case: Evaluating and comparing LLM responses across different providers based on latency, cost, and quality metrics.
cover_image_prompt: A chef standing in a modern kitchen, tasting dishes prepared by robot arms representing different LLM providers. The robot arms present dishes (LLM responses) on plates labeled with provider logos. The chef evaluates each dish based on taste (quality), speed of delivery (latency), and ingredients cost (token usage/cost). Small screens display quality scores and cost metrics. The kitchen is brightly lit with a clean, minimalist design. The composition is a balanced, eye-level shot with a focus on the chef's expression. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and vibrant colors.

name: ssh-bot
description: Telegram bot for executing commands on remote hosts via ssh.
readme_summary: The ssh-bot is a Telegram bot written in Go that allows users to execute commands on remote hosts via SSH. It supports features like persistent SSH connections, real-time output streaming, PTY support, SFTP for file management, and dynamic host management, providing a convenient alternative to VPNs and dedicated SSH clients.
key_features: Executing commands in local or remote (via SSH) environment
Ability to forcibly stop running remote commands
Uploading files to the remote server (SFTP)
Downloading files from the remote server directly to the Telegram chat (SFTP)
Dynamic host manager: adding and deleting servers
Combined access to hosts via key and/or an interactive password prompt
Automatic cleaning of output from ANSI codes
Graceful error handling for commands that require an interactive terminal
primary_use_case: Executing commands on and managing files on remote hosts via Telegram.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a diligent robot butler standing in a high-tech server room, holding a Telegram chat window in its metallic hand. The butler is remotely controlling servers represented as glowing, miniature cities on a table. One city is displaying real-time data streams as the butler types commands into the Telegram window. The robot is also transferring files between a server city and a cloud storage icon via glowing data cables. Small UI elements on the robot's screen show SSH connection details and file transfer progress. The scene is set in a clean, futuristic server room with cool blue lighting. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with sharp details and vibrant colors.
